techmeme.title: In the UK, X and Reddit are blocking wide-ranging content, including about parliamentary debates, Ukraine, and Gaza, to comply with the Online Safety Act (BBC)
Sources: thousands of US export license applications, including for Nvidia's shipments of AI chips to China, are stalled due to US Commerce Department turmoil (Reuters)
Nintendo plans to raise the price of the original Switch "family of systems and products" and some Switch 2 accessories in the US; Switch 2's price won't change (Emma Roth/The Verge)
TikTok launches a new version of its app called TikTok Pro in Germany, Portugal, and Spain, allowing users to earn "virtual sunshine" by supporting charities (Aisha Malik/TechCrunch)
China accuses the US of exploiting an old Microsoft Exchange flaw to control a key Chinese defense company's servers for nearly a year and steal military data (Bloomberg)
